trans-unit.source: Reliable Collections
trans-unit.target: Reliable Collections

trans-unit.source: Reliable Collections enable you to write highly available, scalable, and low latency cloud applications.
trans-unit.target: Reliable Collections enable you to write highly available, scalable, and low latency cloud applications.

trans-unit.source: Reliable Collections
trans-unit.target: Reliable Collections

trans-unit.source: Reliable Collections enable you to write highly available, scalable, and low latency
trans-unit.target: Reliable Collections enable you to write highly available, scalable, and low latency

trans-unit.source: cloud applications as though you are writing single machine applications.
trans-unit.target: cloud applications as though you are writing single machine applications.

trans-unit.source: The classes in the Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Collections namespace provide a set of out-of-the-box
trans-unit.target: The classes in the Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Collections namespace provide a set of out-of-the-box

trans-unit.source: collections that automatically make your state highly available.
trans-unit.target: collections that automatically make your state highly available.

trans-unit.source: Developers need only to program to the Reliable Collection APIs and let Reliable Collections
trans-unit.target: Developers need only to program to the Reliable Collection APIs and let Reliable Collections

trans-unit.source: manage the replicated and local state.
trans-unit.target: manage the replicated and local state.

trans-unit.source: The key difference between Reliable Collections and other high-availability technologies
trans-unit.target: The key difference between Reliable Collections and other high-availability technologies

trans-unit.source: (such as Redis, Azure Table service, and Azure Queue service) is that the state is
trans-unit.target: (such as Redis, Azure Table service, and Azure Queue service) is that the state is

trans-unit.source: kept locally in the service instance while also being made highly available.
trans-unit.target: kept locally in the service instance while also being made highly available.

trans-unit.source: This means that:
trans-unit.target: This means that:

trans-unit.source: All reads are local, which results in low latency and high throughput reads.
trans-unit.target: All reads are local, which results in low latency and high throughput reads.

trans-unit.source: All writes incur the minimum number of network IOs, which results in low latency and high throughput writes.
trans-unit.target: All writes incur the minimum number of network IOs, which results in low latency and high throughput writes.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image of Evolution of Collections.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image of Evolution of Collections.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Reliable Collections can be thought of as the natural evolution of the System.Collections
trans-unit.target: Reliable Collections can be thought of as the natural evolution of the System.Collections

trans-unit.source: classes: a new set of collections that are designed for the cloud and multi-machine
trans-unit.target: classes: a new set of collections that are designed for the cloud and multi-machine

trans-unit.source: applications without increasing complexity for the developer.
trans-unit.target: applications without increasing complexity for the developer.

trans-unit.source: As such, they are:
trans-unit.target: As such, they are:

trans-unit.source: Replicated: State changes are replicated for high availability.
trans-unit.target: Replicated: State changes are replicated for high availability.

trans-unit.source: Persisted: Data is persisted to disk for durability against large-scale outages (for example, a datacenter power outage).
trans-unit.target: Persisted: Data is persisted to disk for durability against large-scale outages (for example, a datacenter power outage).

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous: APIs are asynchronous to ensure threads are not blocked when incurring IO.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous: APIs are asynchronous to ensure threads are not blocked when incurring IO.

trans-unit.source: Transactional: APIs utilize the abstraction of transactions to allow you to manage multiple Reliable Collections within a service easily.
trans-unit.target: Transactional: APIs utilize the abstraction of transactions to allow you to manage multiple Reliable Collections within a service easily.

trans-unit.source: Reliable Collections provide strong consistency guarantees out of the box in order
trans-unit.target: Reliable Collections provide strong consistency guarantees out of the box in order

trans-unit.source: to make reasoning about application state easier.
trans-unit.target: to make reasoning about application state easier.

trans-unit.source: Strong consistency is achieved by ensuring transaction commits only complete after the entire transaction
trans-unit.target: Strong consistency is achieved by ensuring transaction commits only complete after the entire transaction

trans-unit.source: has been applied on a quorum of replicas including the primary.
trans-unit.target: has been applied on a quorum of replicas including the primary.

trans-unit.source: To achieve weaker consistency, application can acknowledge back to the client / requester
trans-unit.target: To achieve weaker consistency, application can acknowledge back to the client / requester

trans-unit.source: before the asynchronous commit returns.
trans-unit.target: before the asynchronous commit returns.

trans-unit.source: The Reliable Collections APIs are an evolution of concurrent collections APIs
trans-unit.target: The Reliable Collections APIs are an evolution of concurrent collections APIs

trans-unit.source: (found in the System.Collections.Concurrent namespace):
trans-unit.target: (found in the System.Collections.Concurrent namespace):

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous: Returns a Task since, unlike Reliable Collections, the operations are replicated and persisted.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronous: Returns a Task since, unlike Reliable Collections, the operations are replicated and persisted.

trans-unit.source: No out parameters: Uses ConditionalResult to return a bool and a value instead of out parameters. ConditionalResult is like Nullable but does not require T to be a struct.
trans-unit.target: No out parameters: Uses ConditionalResult to return a bool and a value instead of out parameters. ConditionalResult is like Nullable but does not require T to be a struct.

trans-unit.source: Transactions: Uses a transaction object to enable the user to group actions on multiple Reliable Collections in a transaction.
trans-unit.target: Transactions: Uses a transaction object to enable the user to group actions on multiple Reliable Collections in a transaction.

trans-unit.source: Today, Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Collections contains two collections:
trans-unit.target: Today, Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Data.Collections contains two collections:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Reliable Dictionary</linkText><title></title></link>: Represents a replicated, transactional, and asynchronous collection of key/value pairs.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Reliable Dictionary</linkText><title></title></link>: Represents a replicated, transactional, and asynchronous collection of key/value pairs.

trans-unit.source: Similar to ConcurrentDictionary, both the key and the value can be of any type.
trans-unit.target: Similar to ConcurrentDictionary, both the key and the value can be of any type.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Reliable Queue</linkText><title></title></link>: Represents a replicated, transactional, and asynchronous strict first-in first-out (FIFO) queue.
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Reliable Queue</linkText><title></title></link>: Represents a replicated, transactional, and asynchronous strict first-in first-out (FIFO) queue.

trans-unit.source: Similar to ConcurrentQueue, the value can be of any type.
trans-unit.target: Similar to ConcurrentQueue, the value can be of any type.

trans-unit.source: Isolation Levels
trans-unit.target: Isolation Levels

trans-unit.source: Isolation level is a measure of the degree isolation is achieved.
trans-unit.target: Isolation level is a measure of the degree isolation is achieved.

trans-unit.source: Isolation means that a transaction behaves as it would in a system that only allows
trans-unit.target: Isolation means that a transaction behaves as it would in a system that only allows

trans-unit.source: one transaction to be in-flight at any given point of time.
trans-unit.target: one transaction to be in-flight at any given point of time.

trans-unit.source: Reliable Collections automatically choose the isolation level to use for a given
trans-unit.target: Reliable Collections automatically choose the isolation level to use for a given

trans-unit.source: read operation depending on the operation and the role of the replica.
trans-unit.target: read operation depending on the operation and the role of the replica.

trans-unit.source: There are two isolation levels that are supported in Reliable Collections:
trans-unit.target: There are two isolation levels that are supported in Reliable Collections:

trans-unit.source: Repeatable Read: "Specifies that statements cannot read data that has been modified but not yet committed by other transactions and that no other transactions can modify data that has been read by the current transaction until the current transaction completes.
trans-unit.target: Repeatable Read: "Specifies that statements cannot read data that has been modified but not yet committed by other transactions and that no other transactions can modify data that has been read by the current transaction until the current transaction completes.

trans-unit.source: (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms173763.aspx)"
trans-unit.target: (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms173763.aspx)"

trans-unit.source: Snapshot: "Specifies that data read by any statement in a transaction will be the transactionally consistent version of the data that existed at the start of the transaction.
trans-unit.target: Snapshot: "Specifies that data read by any statement in a transaction will be the transactionally consistent version of the data that existed at the start of the transaction.

trans-unit.source: The transaction can only recognize data modifications that were committed before the start of the transaction.
trans-unit.target: The transaction can only recognize data modifications that were committed before the start of the transaction.

trans-unit.source: Data modifications made by other transactions after the start of the current transaction are not visible to statements executing in the current transaction.
trans-unit.target: Data modifications made by other transactions after the start of the current transaction are not visible to statements executing in the current transaction.

trans-unit.source: The effect is as if the statements in a transaction get a snapshot of the committed data as it existed at the start of the transaction.
trans-unit.target: The effect is as if the statements in a transaction get a snapshot of the committed data as it existed at the start of the transaction.

trans-unit.source: (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms173763.aspx)"
trans-unit.target: (https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms173763.aspx)"

trans-unit.source: Both the Reliable Dictionary and the Reliable Queue support Read Your Writes.
trans-unit.target: Both the Reliable Dictionary and the Reliable Queue support Read Your Writes.

trans-unit.source: In other words, any write within a transaction will be visible to a following read
trans-unit.target: In other words, any write within a transaction will be visible to a following read

trans-unit.source: that belongs to the same transaction.
trans-unit.target: that belongs to the same transaction.

trans-unit.source: Persistence Model
trans-unit.target: Persistence Model

trans-unit.source: Reliable State Manager and Reliable Collections follow a persistence model that is called Log and Checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: Reliable State Manager and Reliable Collections follow a persistence model that is called Log and Checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: This is a model where each state change is logged on disk and only applied in memory.
trans-unit.target: This is a model where each state change is logged on disk and only applied in memory.

trans-unit.source: The complete state itself is only persisted occasionally (aka.
trans-unit.target: The complete state itself is only persisted occasionally (aka.

trans-unit.source: Checkpoint).
trans-unit.target: Checkpoint).

trans-unit.source: The benefit it provides is:
trans-unit.target: The benefit it provides is:

trans-unit.source: Deltas are turned into sequential append-only writes on disk for improved performance.
trans-unit.target: Deltas are turned into sequential append-only writes on disk for improved performance.

trans-unit.source: To better understand the log and checkpoint model, let’s first look at the infinite disk scenario.
trans-unit.target: To better understand the log and checkpoint model, let’s first look at the infinite disk scenario.

trans-unit.source: Reliable State Manager logs every operation before it is replicated.
trans-unit.target: Reliable State Manager logs every operation before it is replicated.

trans-unit.source: This allows the Reliable Collection to only apply the operation in memory.
trans-unit.target: This allows the Reliable Collection to only apply the operation in memory.

trans-unit.source: Since logs are persisted, even when the replica fails and needs to be restarted, the Reliable State Manager
trans-unit.target: Since logs are persisted, even when the replica fails and needs to be restarted, the Reliable State Manager

trans-unit.source: has enough information in its logs to replay all the operations the replica has lost.
trans-unit.target: has enough information in its logs to replay all the operations the replica has lost.

trans-unit.source: As disk is infinite, log records never need to be removed and the Reliable Collection only needs to manage the in-memory state.
trans-unit.target: As disk is infinite, log records never need to be removed and the Reliable Collection only needs to manage the in-memory state.

trans-unit.source: Now let’s look at the finite disk scenario.
trans-unit.target: Now let’s look at the finite disk scenario.

trans-unit.source: At one point the Reliable State Manager will run out of disk space.
trans-unit.target: At one point the Reliable State Manager will run out of disk space.

trans-unit.source: Before that happens the Reliable State Manager needs to truncate its log to make room for the newer records.
trans-unit.target: Before that happens the Reliable State Manager needs to truncate its log to make room for the newer records.

trans-unit.source: It will request the Reliable Collections to checkpoint their in-memory state.
trans-unit.target: It will request the Reliable Collections to checkpoint their in-memory state.

trans-unit.source: It is the Reliable Collection's responsibility to persist its state up to that point.
trans-unit.target: It is the Reliable Collection's responsibility to persist its state up to that point.

trans-unit.source: Once the Reliable Collections complete their checkpoints, the Reliable State Manager can truncate the log to free up disk space.
trans-unit.target: Once the Reliable Collections complete their checkpoints, the Reliable State Manager can truncate the log to free up disk space.

trans-unit.source: This way, when the replica needs to be restarted, Reliable Collections will recover their
trans-unit.target: This way, when the replica needs to be restarted, Reliable Collections will recover their

trans-unit.source: checkpointed state, and the Reliable State Manager will recover and play back all the state changes that occurred
trans-unit.target: checkpointed state, and the Reliable State Manager will recover and play back all the state changes that occurred

trans-unit.source: since the checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: since the checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: Locking
trans-unit.target: Locking

trans-unit.source: In Reliable Collections, all transactions are two-phased: a transaction does not release
trans-unit.target: In Reliable Collections, all transactions are two-phased: a transaction does not release

trans-unit.source: the locks it has acquired until the transaction terminates with either an abort or commit.
trans-unit.target: the locks it has acquired until the transaction terminates with either an abort or commit.

trans-unit.source: Reliable Collections always take Exclusive locks.
trans-unit.target: Reliable Collections always take Exclusive locks.

trans-unit.source: For reads, the locking is dependent on couple of factors.
trans-unit.target: For reads, the locking is dependent on couple of factors.

trans-unit.source: Any read operation done using Shapshot Isolation is lock free.
trans-unit.target: Any read operation done using Shapshot Isolation is lock free.

trans-unit.source: Any Repeatable read operation by default takes Shared locks.
trans-unit.target: Any Repeatable read operation by default takes Shared locks.

trans-unit.source: However, for any read operation that supports Repeatable Read, user can ask for an
trans-unit.target: However, for any read operation that supports Repeatable Read, user can ask for an

trans-unit.source: Update lock instead of the Shared lock.
trans-unit.target: Update lock instead of the Shared lock.

trans-unit.source: Update lock is an asymmetric lock used to prevent a common form of deadlock that
trans-unit.target: Update lock is an asymmetric lock used to prevent a common form of deadlock that

trans-unit.source: occurs when multiple transactions lock resources for potential update at a later time.
trans-unit.target: occurs when multiple transactions lock resources for potential update at a later time.

trans-unit.source: The lock compatibility matrix can be found below:
trans-unit.target: The lock compatibility matrix can be found below:

trans-unit.source: Request \ Granted
trans-unit.target: Request \ Granted

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: Shared
trans-unit.target: Shared

trans-unit.source: Update
trans-unit.target: Update

trans-unit.target: Exclusive

trans-unit.target: Shared

trans-unit.target: No Conflict

trans-unit.target: Conflict

trans-unit.source: Conflict
trans-unit.target: Conflict

trans-unit.source: Note that timeout argument in the Reliable Collections APIs are used as a deadlock detection.
trans-unit.target: Note that timeout argument in the Reliable Collections APIs are used as a deadlock detection.

trans-unit.source: For example, two transactions (T1 and T2) are trying to read and update K1.
trans-unit.target: For example, two transactions (T1 and T2) are trying to read and update K1.

trans-unit.source: It is possible for them to deadlock, because they both end up having the Shared lock.
trans-unit.target: It is possible for them to deadlock, because they both end up having the Shared lock.

trans-unit.source: In this case, one or both of the operations will timeout.
trans-unit.target: In this case, one or both of the operations will timeout.

trans-unit.source: Note that the above deadlock scenario is a great example of how Update lock can prevent deadlocks.
trans-unit.target: Note that the above deadlock scenario is a great example of how Update lock can prevent deadlocks.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: DO NOT modify an object of custom type returned by read operations (e.g TryPeekAsync or TryGetAsync).
trans-unit.target: DO NOT modify an object of custom type returned by read operations (e.g TryPeekAsync or TryGetAsync).

trans-unit.source: Reliable Collections, just like Concurrent Collections, return a reference to the objects and not a copy.
trans-unit.target: Reliable Collections, just like Concurrent Collections, return a reference to the objects and not a copy.

trans-unit.source: DO deep copy returned object of custom type before modifying it.
trans-unit.target: DO deep copy returned object of custom type before modifying it.

trans-unit.source: Since, structs and built-in types are pass-by-value, you do not need to do a deep copy on them.
trans-unit.target: Since, structs and built-in types are pass-by-value, you do not need to do a deep copy on them.

trans-unit.source: DO NOT use TimeSpan.MaxValue for timeouts.
trans-unit.target: DO NOT use TimeSpan.MaxValue for timeouts.

trans-unit.source: Timeouts should be used to detect deadlocks.
trans-unit.target: Timeouts should be used to detect deadlocks.

trans-unit.source: DO NOT create a transaction within another transaction’s using statement because it can cause deadlocks.
trans-unit.target: DO NOT create a transaction within another transaction’s using statement because it can cause deadlocks.

trans-unit.source: Here are some things to keep in mind:
trans-unit.target: Here are some things to keep in mind:

trans-unit.source: The default timeout is 4 seconds for all the Reliable Collection APIs.
trans-unit.target: The default timeout is 4 seconds for all the Reliable Collection APIs.

trans-unit.source: Most users should not override this.
trans-unit.target: Most users should not override this.

trans-unit.source: The default cancellation token is CancellationToken.None in all Reliable Collections APIs.
trans-unit.target: The default cancellation token is CancellationToken.None in all Reliable Collections APIs.

trans-unit.source: Enumerations are snapshot consistent within a collection.
trans-unit.target: Enumerations are snapshot consistent within a collection.

trans-unit.source: However, enumerations of multiple collections are not consistent across collections.
trans-unit.target: However, enumerations of multiple collections are not consistent across collections.

trans-unit.source: To achieve high availability for the Reliable Collections, each service should have at least a target and minimum replica set size of 3.
trans-unit.target: To achieve high availability for the Reliable Collections, each service should have at least a target and minimum replica set size of 3.
